paragraphs.text: Nigeria's old impeachment games.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Recently the former president labelled many Nigerian federal legislators as thieves and looters
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: According to him, they indulge in extorting money from departments, contractors and ministries
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "When the guard is the thief," Obasanjo lamented," only God can keep the house safe and secure."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: With what is presently playing out at the National Assembly of Nigeria, Obasanjo may be right after all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Currently, some lawmakers are purportedly plotting to remove President Goodluck Jonathan from office
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: About 65 out of 109 Senators are reportedly involved in the plot
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These anti-Jonathan lawmakers have told whoever cared to listen that they would table the president's sins on December 16, 2014
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: when they reconvene from their current recess
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Chief among the president's reported sins are failure to contain the raging insurgency in the north; refusal to sign some bills; and alleged unauthorised expenditure of 1.7 trillion Naira (about $9.5bn) on the oil subsidy fund in 2011
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: True, the security situation in the country is not palatable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it has always been so since 2009
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when Boko Haram started its violent uprising
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No doubt, the president needs to demonstrate that he is capable of putting the terrorists to rout
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: why are the senators just waking up to the existential realities in Nigeria?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why are they just discovering that the president spent more than what was approved for the oil subsidy fund in 2011?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The point is, the lawmakers desperately need financial and political support to pursue their campaigns for the general elections coming up in February 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the best way to get this, I suspect, is to blackmail the president with impeachment or removal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a bid to retain his seat, the president is supposed to calm them down by greasing their palms and supporting their bids for re-election
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For many Nigerians, the legislators are actually acting true to type
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In August 2002, when the nation was preparing for the 2003 general elections, the National Assembly waved the impeachment flag against the then President Obasanjo
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The lower chamber, the House of Representatives, gave the him an ultimatum to resign within two weeks or be removed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They accused Obasanjo of incompetence and abuse of office
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At the end of the day, the so-called impeachment turned out to be a storm in a teacup
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It has become a tradition that whenever the lawmakers want anything done in their favour, they arm-twist the executive with threats of probes or impeachment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But most of the probes end up an exercise in futility
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Nobody is punished
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No credible result is released
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2009, the then Special Adviser on Petroleum to the president, Dr Emmanuel Egbogah, alleged that oil companies took some senators to Ghana to feed and bribe them to oppose the oil and gas reforms being initiated by the federal government
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Naturally, the senators were angry
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They called for a probe of the allegations
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Senate President David Mark thundered then,"There is going to be a serious public hearing... because when people begin to beckon at their whims and caprices to label us in the way they want, we should take it seriously."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Nothing concrete came out of this
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There was also a probe of the power sector reforms undertaken by the then President Olusegun Obasanjo
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The Ndudi Elumelu-led committee of the House of Representatives that probed the rot in the power sector spent millions of Naira in the course of conducting their investigations
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They turned in many volumes of the report on the probe
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the end, the House set up an ad hoc committee to review the report
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the review committee dropped the probe report
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It reportedly accused the Elumelu panel of lacking understanding of the nature of power sector contracts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Hence
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it exonerated the Obasanjo-led government of mismanaging funds for power projects
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The rot in this power sector is still haunting Nigerians up until today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Undoubtedly, our lawmakers are incurable lawbreakers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes, they engage in physical combat in the chambers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes, their unruly behaviour leaves even children wondering why such supposedly mature individuals have become soup-guzzling elders
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They collect jumbo pay only to pass a few bills and devote most of their time in shadow-boxing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A good number of these legislators, for instance, never sponsored any bill since they were elected
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some care less about the interest of their constituents and don't report back to them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They have also failed in their oversight of ministries and government agencies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The House has committees in charge of different government ministries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what some members of these committees do, sometimes, is to demand monetary inducement to pass the budget of these ministries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: money is the name of the game
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Last year, The Economist of London reported that Nigerian legislators were about the highest paid in the world
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: According to the newspaper, with the basic salary of $189,500 per annum, the Nigerian legislator earns 116 times the country's Gross Domestic Product per capita of $1,600
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Still
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: many of the legislators frequently agitate for increase in their already bloated salaries and allowances
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For instance
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in 2010, some members of the House of Representatives, not satisfied with their personal quarterly allocation of 27.2 million Naira ($153,000), wanted their quarterly allocation increased to 42 million Naira ($234,000) for each of them
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The budget of the House could not accommodate it then
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Hence
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the lawmakers reportedly suggested collapsing the capital budget of the House to take care of their request
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It would serve the Nigerian nation better
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the job of the lawmakers is on a part-time basis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: their salaries are drastically cut
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That way, many of them will not find it attractive to contest the position for the sake of the lucrative pay, not to mention thinking of issuing threats they will never carry through
paragraphs.label: assumption
